idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# New TunePad cell

# Set the instrument to piano for a calming effect

# Define notes in the key of C major for a gentle, soothing sound
C4, E4, G4 = 60, 64, 67  # Basic C major chord
F4, A4, C5 = 65, 69, 72  # F major chord
G3, D4, B4 = 55, 62, 71  # G chord for variety

# Define a function for a simple, repeating piano melody
def calming_piano():
    playNote(C4, beats=1.5)  # Slow down each note to keep it gentle
    playNote(E4, beats=1.5)
    playNote(G4, beats=2)    # Hold the final note for a bit longer
    rest(1)              # Rest for a pause

    playNote(F4, beats=1.5)  # Move to an F major chord
    playNote(A4, beats=1.5)
    playNote(C5, beats=2)
    rest(1)              # Pause between chords

    playNote(G3, beats=1.5)  # Shift to a G chord
    playNote(D4, beats=1.5)
    playNote(B4, beats=2)
    rest(1)
    

# Play the calming piano melody
calming_piano()

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# New TunePad cell
# Define notes for the melody, in the key of C major
C5, D5, E5, G5, A5 = 72, 74, 76, 79, 81  # Higher notes for a light melody
F4, G4, A4, C4 = 65, 67, 69, 60  # Mid-range notes for variation

# Define a melody function to go along with the calming piano chords
def stress_relief_melody():
    playNote(C5, beats=1)    # Start with a gentle, steady note
    playNote(E5, beats=1)
    playNote(D5, beats=1.5)  # Hold for a bit longer to keep it soft
    rest(0.5)            # Short pause

    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    playNote(A5, beats=1)
    playNote(G5, beats=1.5)  # Adding slight movement with variation
    rest(0.5)            # Small pause for a calming effect

    playNote(F4, beats=1.5)  # Mid-range for warmth and depth
    playNote(G4, beats=1)
    playNote(A4, beats=1.5)
    rest(1)              # Longer rest to create space

    playNote(C4, beats=1.5)  # Soft return to the main key
    playNote(D5, beats=1)
    playNote(G4, beats=2)
    rest(1)
    
    playNote(C5, beats=1)  # Start with a gentle, steady note at lower volume
    playNote(E5, beats=1)
    playNote(D5, beats=1.5)  # Hold for a bit longer to keep it soft
    rest(0.5)                       # Short pause

    playNote(G5, beats=1)
    playNote(A5, beats=1)
    playNote(G5, beats=1.5) 
    rest(0.5)                        # Small pause for a calming effect

    playNote(F4, beats=1.5)  # Mid-range for warmth and depth
    playNote(G4, beats=1)
    playNote(A4, beats=1.5)
    rest(1)                          # Longer rest to create space

    playNote(C4, beats=1.5)  # Soft return to the main key
    playNote(D5, beats=1)
    playNote(G4, beats=2)
    rest(1)


# Play the stress relief melody on top of the piano chords
stress_relief_melody()

idata.author: Anonymous
idata.python:
# New TunePad cell

# Define notes for the melody, in the key of C major
C5, D5, E5, G5, A5 = 72, 74, 76, 79, 81  # Higher notes for a light melody
F4, G4, A4, C4 = 65, 67, 69, 60  # Mid-range notes for variation

# Define a melody function to go along with the calming piano chords
def stress_relief_melody():
    play(C5, beats=1, volume=0.6)  # Start with a gentle, steady note at lower volume
    play(E5, beats=1, volume=0.6)
    play(D5, beats=1.5, volume=0.7)  # Hold for a bit longer to keep it soft
    rest(0.5)                       # Short pause

    play(G5, beats=1, volume=0.6)
    play(A5, beats=1, volume=0.7)
    play(G5, beats=1.5, volume=0.6)  # Adding slight movement with variation
    rest(0.5)                        # Small pause for a calming effect

    play(F4, beats=1.5, volume=0.6)  # Mid-range for warmth and depth
    play(G4, beats=1, volume=0.6)
    play(A4, beats=1.5, volume=0.7)
    rest(1)                          # Longer rest to create space

    play(C4, beats=1.5, volume=0.6)  # Soft return to the main key
    play(D5, beats=1, volume=0.7)
    play(G4, beats=2, volume=0.6)
    rest(1)

# Define the calming strings section
def calming_strings():
    # Strings pad that harmonizes with the melody, using a simple chord progression
    playNote(C4, beats=4)  # Soft C major chord
    rest(2)

    playNote(F4, beats=4)  # Soft F major chord
    rest(2)

    playNote(G4, beats=4)  # Soft G major chord
    rest(2)

    playNote(C4, beats=4)  # Return to C major
    rest(2)

# Play the stress relief melody on top of the piano chords and calming strings
def stress_relief_with_strings():
    # Start the string section as a backdrop
    calming_strings()

  # Execute the calming melody with strings
stress_relief_with_strings()
